actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit individuals to receive tax-free distributions from an individual retirement account or annuity to purchase their first home.

summary.text: Home Ownership Opportunity Act of 1989 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from the gross income of a first-time homebuyer up to $10,000 of individual retirement plan distributions used within 90 days to acquire a principal residence. Requires that amounts equal to the distributions in question be paid into the affected account at least 12 months prior to the purchase of the home.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit individuals to receive tax-free distributions from an individual retirement account or annuity to purchase their first home.
